citizens_bank_international(cibl).bank_vision: To be the leading bank known for its service excellence in the region.
citizens_bank_international(cibl).bank_mission: To be a trustworthy partner for the progress of individuals and institutions by designing, producing and delivering the best financial solutions.
citizens_bank_international(cibl).bank_objectives: The objectives of Citizens Bank International Limited are: To provide standard and reliable financial services to the general public, by protecting and promoting the rights and interests of the depositors and shareholders of the Bank. To bring about such financial resources, from internal and external sources, as may be required for the establishment, development, expansion and enhancement of capability and productivity of agriculture, industry, service, trade and other productive business which appears viable from business viewpoint, and thereby render support for bringing about dynamism in the development of industrial, trade and agricultural sectors of the country. To provide financial resources and services to establish, operate, develop, expand and promote manufacturing and employment-oriented business in rural and urban areas by properly mobilizing the available skills, labor and capital and thereby render support for poverty alleviation. To provide financial intermediary service through institutional investment by integrating the capital scattered in the country. To be responsive to the needs of the society and taking responsibility to meet the due concerns of the society through CSR.
citizens_bank_international(cibl).about_us: Established on April 20, 2007 (2064/01/07) as 20th commercial bank of the nation, “Citizens Bank International Limited”, has its corporate office at the heart of the financial sector of the country, Narayanhiti Path, Kathmandu. It is promoted by eminent personalities, business and industrial houses and reputed individuals having high social standing and has been managed by a team of experienced bankers and professionals. There are 192 branches and 154 ATMs all over the country. The bank has 3 extension counter and 97 branchless banking all over the country.

chief_executive_officer(ceo)_information.name: Ganesh Raj Pokharel
chief_executive_officer(ceo)_information.about_ceo: Ganesh Raj Pokharel, a professional banker with more than 25 years of experience, is one of the founders and the Chief Executive Officer of Citizens Bank International Ltd. Prior to his appointment as the Chief Executive Officer, he had headed various departments of the Bank playing crucial roles. His area of expertise includes overall business operations and development. He is a charismatic leader with vision and has sound interpersonal relationship skills with different stakeholders. Before joining Citizens Bank, he served as Management Expert for 14 years. He holds an Executive MBA degree in Finance from Kathmandu University; and MBA (Marketing) and BL (Banking) degrees from Tribhuvan University.

eligibility_criteria.age_requirement: The applicant must be at least 18 years old and should not exceed 60 years at the time of loan maturity.
eligibility_criteria.income_criteria: The eligibility criteria include all self-employed Nepalese citizens engaged in micro-businesses, entrepreneurs, or those with other reasonable sources of income, as well as any business unit in operation, having a PAN number, and registered with any government entity, including Gaunpalikas and municipalities.
eligibility_criteria.collateral_requirement: Freehold agricultural land is also acceptable as collateral for the loan. The derived value of the collateral is determined as the minimum of the following: five times the government value for properties located in VDCs, three times the government value for properties located in municipalities, or 60% of the market value ascertained by the bank or the fair market value provided by an authorized valuator of the bank.

citizens_fast_track_loan.description: To meet financial requirement of the borrower, both individuals and business units, for agriculture/business/personal use.

features.loan_limits: Up to NPR 2.0 Million
features.repayment_terms: Term Loan / Overdraft Loan with 1-year of revolving facility

loan_portion.value: Up to 80% of the distressed value in case of real estate property having minimum 8 ft. road access to be mortgaged in favor of the bank.
loan_portion.or: 60% of derived value of collateral having less than 8 ft. road access or no road access to be mortgaged in favor of the bank.

eligibility_criteria.income_criteria: All self-employed Nepalese citizens engaged in micro-businesses, entrepreneurs, or having other reasonable sources of income are eligible; any business unit in operation, having a PAN number, and registered with any government entity, including Gaunpalikas and municipalities, qualifies for the loan.
eligibility_criteria.age_requirement: The applicant must be at least 18 years old and should not exceed 60 years at the time of loan maturity.
eligibility_criteria.collateral_requirement: Freehold agricultural land is acceptable as collateral; the derived value must meet one of the following conditions: five times the government value for properties located in VDCs, three times the government value for properties in municipalities, or 60% of the market value ascertained by the bank or the fair market value provided by an authorized valuator of the bank. The loan portion can be up to 80% of the distressed value for real estate properties with a minimum of 8 ft. road access, or up to 60% of the derived value for properties with less than 8 ft. road access or no road access, to be mortgaged in favor of the bank.

citizens_visa_debit_card.description: Issued by Citizens Bank International Limited, can be used at any ATMs and POS machines linked to Visa Network and NEPS Network within Nepal and India.

additional_services: Can be used at any ATMs and POS machines linked to Visa Network and NEPS Network within Nepal and India.
Convenient way to make payments for goods and services.
No need to carry cash; can be used 24/7.
Provides safety tips to protect against fraud and misuse.
Cash Withdrawal
Balance Enquiry
PIN Code Change
Mini Statement
Make Purchase through POS Terminals
Each card has a unique Personal Identification Number (PIN) for transaction security.

Transaction limits and charges include: Within Nepal - ATM transactions have a per transaction limit of NPR 25,000, daily limit of NPR 100,000, monthly limit of NPR 400,000, and 10 transactions per day; POS transactions have a per transaction limit of NPR 200,000, daily limit of NPR 300,000, and monthly limit of NPR 1,000,000; Online transactions have the same limits as POS transactions. Within India - ATM transactions have a per transaction, daily, and monthly limit of NPR 24,000, with 10 transactions per day; POS and online transactions have a per transaction, daily, and monthly limit of NPR 160,000; Special POS transactions for hotels, hospitals, and pharmacies have limits of NPR 800,000 per transaction, NPR 1,600,000 daily, and NPR 3,200,000 monthly. In foreign currency - ATM transactions are limited to USD 1,000 per transaction and daily, and USD 5,000 monthly; POS transactions have a limit of USD 2,000 per transaction and daily, and USD 5,000 monthly; Online transactions are limited to USD 1,000 per transaction, USD 2,000 daily, and USD 2,000 monthly. Other limits include contactless payments up to NPR 5,000 per transaction with 5 transactions per day, dollar card limits of USD 2,000 yearly for online transactions and USD 15,000 yearly for ATM, POS, and online combined, and credit card cash withdrawal limits of 10% of the credit limit. Transaction fees for Visa NPR debit cards are: Free for cash withdrawal, balance enquiry, mini statements, and PIN changes at CTZN ATMs; Rs. 15 for cash withdrawal and Rs. 5 for balance enquiry or mini statements at member ATMs; Rs. 15 for cash withdrawal and Rs. 20 for balance enquiry at non-member ATMs in Nepal; Rs. 250 for cash withdrawal and Rs. 50 for balance enquiry at ATMs in India; and Rs. 200 plus 2% of the transaction for POS cash advances.

citizens_instalment_scheme_npr.description: This scheme allows Credit Card holders to purchase goods and services through listed merchants and pay in equal monthly installments at 0% interest rate. The loan amount ranges from NPR 20,000 to NPR 250,000, with up to 100% financing of the product cost, an additional limit of 0.5 times the existing credit card limit, available only at listed merchants, and repayment options of 3 to 18 equal monthly installments.

citizens_insta_buy_emi_scheme.description: This scheme allows Credit Card holders to purchase goods and services at any merchant location at a low interest rate. The loan amount ranges from NPR 10,000 to NPR 250,000, with up to 100% financing of the product cost, a financial charge rate of 0.833% per month (10% p.a.), and installment options of 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, or 18 months.

eligibility_criteria: Nepalese citizen with 18 years of age
Individuals with stable and regular source of income from business, service or property
citizens_visa_credit_card.required_documents: For salaried personnel: Credit Card Application form duly filled and signed, Passport Size Photographs (2 Copies), Copy of Citizenship Certificate/Passport, Salary Certificate/letter from employer disclosing the designation and present salary, Copy of Bank Account Statement for last six to twelve months. For business income earners: Credit Card Application form duly filled and signed, Passport Size Photographs (2 Copies), Copy of Citizenship Certificate/Passport, Financial Statement of last two years, Photocopy of Registration, PAN/VAT Certificate and/or license from concerned authority, Copy of Bank Account Statement for last six to twelve months, Memorandum and Articles of Association, Board Resolution to Borrow, paper disclosing percentage of ownership/shareholding, Partnership Deed.

additional_services: Valid all over Nepal, India & Bhutan
Credit Limit starting from Rs. 20,000.00
Interest charge is free for credit cycle of 45 days
Advance Cash Withdrawal facility of 10% of Credit Card Limit
EMV (Chip based) Secured Card
Get SMS and Email alert of your transaction
Supplementary Card Facility
Auto Debit Facility
Hassle-free solution of carrying cash

green_pin.description: GREEN PIN is a paperless PIN generation for Debit/Credit Cards through ATM with One Time Password (OTP) sent to the customer’s mobile number registered with the bank.

additional_services: Alternative solution of Paper PIN
Instant PIN generation and no need to wait days to get the Paper PIN
Cardholders won’t need to visit the bank to collect their PIN
Can be used by both existing as well as new customers on request
Secure and convenient
Green PIN OTP will be used for only one time to set the new PIN. After the new PIN is set by the cardholder, it will work as usual.

To set your PIN at an ATM: Step 1 - After activating your card, visit any Citizens Bank ATM, insert the card, and select your preferred language. Step 2 - A 6-digit OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number via SMS. Step 3 - Enter the OTP and press 'Continue.' Step 4 - After OTP validation, enter a 4-digit number of your choice as the new PIN and press 'Enter.' Step 5 - Re-enter the 4-digit PIN for confirmation. Step 6 - PIN change will be completed successfully; please memorize your new PIN.

sct_upi_debit_card.description: EBL (Everest Bank) Debit Card acts as an electronic Cheque, which enables you to have direct access to your bank account, for fulfilling your daily payment and cash requirements. It is an alternative payment method to cash and cheques, which enable you to pay directly during purchases of goods and services from merchants (POS Outlets) or draw cash from ATM terminals. EBL Card product, affiliated with SmartChoice Technologies (SCT) with co-branding of Union Pay International (UPI). The card allows you to draw cash from SCT Network & UPI affiliated ATMs in Nepal and NPCI affiliated ATMs in India. It can be used for payments at merchant locations within Nepal and India. Instant issuance is available, and there are no charges for using the EBL Debit card at ATMs or for purchases at POS outlets. SCT Debit cards are issued free of cost to all Saving Premium account holders. For card service fees, the charges associated with the SCT – UPI Card and VISA Card include a Card Issuance Fee that offers two options: Option 1 for an upfront payment of Rs. 1500, or Option 2 for installment payments of Rs. 400 every year for four years. Additionally, there are no charges for Card Replacement, Card Re-Issuance, or PIN Re-Generation. For transaction fees, the fees for using SCT-UPI and VISA Cards include no charges for cash withdrawals from EBL ATMs, while withdrawals from ATMs in Nepal incur a fee of Rs. 15, and withdrawals from ATMs in India carry a charge of Rs. 300. Balance inquiries at EBL ATMs are free, but inquiries at ATMs in Nepal and India cost Rs. 15 and Rs. 50, respectively. Purchases made at POS terminals are also free of charge. Moreover, a 0.15% fee is levied on transactions done in India for exchange trading. To apply for a debit card, you need to collect the 'Debit Card Application Form' from any EBL branch or download it online. After filling out the form for the desired card type (either SCT or Visa), submit it to the respective branch. Once processed, you can collect your card and PIN code on the same day for an Instant card (Non-personalized), or on the specified day for an Embossed card (Personalized). To use the card, start by memorizing your PIN and, for SCT cards, changing the provided PIN at an ATM. For Visa cards, changing the PIN is not compulsory, but it's recommended. To make payments at merchant outlets, hand over your card at the POS terminal, where the merchant will swipe it, and you'll enter your PIN. After that, sign two receipts—one for you and one for the merchant. For cash withdrawals at ATMs, insert your card, enter the PIN, and select the withdrawal amount. Always ensure to take your card, cash, and receipt. If your card is lost or stolen, report it immediately to block further usage, and apply for a replacement at the bank. For safety, treat your card like cash, sign the signature panel, memorize and securely store your PIN, and periodically change it. Never share your PIN or allow others to use your card. Always keep your card in safe custody, check your account regularly, and report any discrepancies to the bank within 30 days. The terms and conditions for using the debit card can be viewed in the Debit Card Application Form, and for any queries, you can contact the bank at their hunting line or via email at debitcard@ebl.com.np.
eligibility_criteria: Any individuals or organizations, holding accounts (Saving Account, Current Account and Saving Premium Account) at any branches of the bank, are eligible to receive EBL Debit card.
The existing account holders can apply at any time and new account opening customers can apply at the time of opening of the account itself.
features: Can be used to draw cash from SCT Network & UPI affiliated ATMs in Nepal and NPCI affiliated ATMs in India.
Accepted as the mode of payment at merchant locations (POS outlets) within the territory of Nepal and India.
Instant Issuance and economical charges.
Round the clock service.
No charges are levied for using EBL Debit card at EBL ATM terminals.
No charges are levied for the purchase of goods and services from merchant (POS) outlets.
SCT Debit cards are issued free of cost to all Saving Premium account holders.

visa_debit_card.description: EBL (Everest Bank) Debit Card acts as an electronic Cheque, which enables you to have direct access to your bank account, for fulfilling your daily payment and cash requirements. It is an alternative payment method to cash and cheques, which enable you to pay directly during purchases of goods and services from merchants (POS Outlets) or draw cash from ATM terminals. EBL Card product, affiliated with Visa Worldwide (VISA). It allows you to draw cash from all Visa affiliated ATMs in Nepal and India and is accepted at all Visa affiliated merchant locations (POS Outlets). The card features instant issuance, round-the-clock service, and no charges for using EBL Debit card at ATMs or for purchases. Discounts of variable percentages are offered on shopping from selected merchants. For card service fees, the charges associated with the SCT – UPI Card and VISA Card include a Card Issuance Fee that offers two options: Option 1 for an upfront payment of Rs. 1500, or Option 2 for installment payments of Rs. 400 every year for four years. Additionally, there are no charges for Card Replacement, Card Re-Issuance, or PIN Re-Generation. For transaction fees, the fees for using SCT-UPI and VISA Cards include no charges for cash withdrawals from EBL ATMs, while withdrawals from ATMs in Nepal incur a fee of Rs. 15, and withdrawals from ATMs in India carry a charge of Rs. 300. Balance inquiries at EBL ATMs are free, but inquiries at ATMs in Nepal and India cost Rs. 15 and Rs. 50, respectively. Purchases made at POS terminals are also free of charge. Moreover, a 0.15% fee is levied on transactions done in India for exchange trading. To apply for a debit card, you need to collect the 'Debit Card Application Form' from any EBL branch or download it online. After filling out the form for the desired card type (either SCT or Visa), submit it to the respective branch. Once processed, you can collect your card and PIN code on the same day for an Instant card (Non-personalized), or on the specified day for an Embossed card (Personalized). To use the card, start by memorizing your PIN and, for SCT cards, changing the provided PIN at an ATM. For Visa cards, changing the PIN is not compulsory, but it's recommended. To make payments at merchant outlets, hand over your card at the POS terminal, where the merchant will swipe it, and you'll enter your PIN. After that, sign two receipts—one for you and one for the merchant. For cash withdrawals at ATMs, insert your card, enter the PIN, and select the withdrawal amount. Always ensure to take your card, cash, and receipt. If your card is lost or stolen, report it immediately to block further usage, and apply for a replacement at the bank. For safety, treat your card like cash, sign the signature panel, memorize and securely store your PIN, and periodically change it. Never share your PIN or allow others to use your card. Always keep your card in safe custody, check your account regularly, and report any discrepancies to the bank within 30 days. The terms and conditions for using the debit card can be viewed in the Debit Card Application Form, and for any queries, you can contact the bank at their hunting line or via email at debitcard@ebl.com.np.

visa_domestic_credit_card.description: Everest Bank is serving “VISA Domestic Credit Card” to its customers, which can be used at ATM & POS Networks, affiliated with Visa Worldwide, scattered throughout Nepal and India.EBL (Everest Bank) Credit Card allows you to make payments on goods and services from merchant outlets or withdraw cash from ATMs. The card is Chip-based, with an interest-free credit period of 15 to 45 days for purchase transactions. The credit limit ranges from NPR 50,000 to 5 Lac, with a competitive interest rate of 2% per month. To apply for a Visa Domestic Credit Card, visit your nearest branch to obtain the application form or download it online, fill it out, and submit it to the branch where your deposit or loan account is maintained or at your convenience; then collect your card and pin code after the specified day and activate it, allowing you to use the card at ATM/DOS terminals in Nepal and India where Visa is accepted. To use your Visa Domestic Credit Card, memorize your PIN, then use the card at POS by giving it to merchant officials to swipe, entering your PIN if required, and signing two receipts; at ATMs, insert your card, enter your PIN, select the desired withdrawal amount, and collect your cash, card, and receipt; to pay due amounts, settle at least the minimum due by the due date to avoid penalties, with interest applied to ATM withdrawals from the transaction date; for safety, treat your card like cash, sign it upon receipt, keep your PIN secure, and report any lost card immediately; the card usage adheres to specific terms and conditions, available in the application form; for assistance, contact 00977-1-4543377 or email creditcard@ebl.com.np. The transaction limits for the Visa Domestic Credit Card are NPR 20,000 per transaction, with a daily ATM cash withdrawal limit of NPR 50,000 and a monthly limit of NPR 100,000 in Nepal; daily purchases from POS are limited to NPR 100,000, with a monthly limit of NPR 500,000, and up to 3 ATM and 10 POS transactions per day; in India, the maximum transaction limit is INR 10,000, daily ATM withdrawal limit is INR 15,000, and monthly withdrawal limit is INR 100,000, with daily POS purchases limited to INR 100,000 and a monthly POS purchase limit of INR 100,000 (INR 300,000 for medical and hotel purchases); fees include NPR 300 for card issuance, NPR 500 for annual renewal, NPR 300 for card replacement or reissuance, and other charges for PIN regeneration, dispute management, late payments, over-limit fees, and auto-pay failures.

green_pin.description: Green Pin is a paperless PIN generation facility that enables customers to generate or regenerate debit/credit card PINs at EBL ATMs anytime. To generate a Green PIN, start by inserting your card into the ATM card reader and pressing the 'Green PIN' button. Next, press the 'Generate OTP' button, and a 6-digit OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number. Afterward, remove your card, reinsert it into the card reader, and press the 'Green PIN' button again. Then, select the 'Set PIN' button, enter the 6-digit OTP you received, and press OK. Finally, type a 4-digit 'New PIN' of your choice, retype it, and press enter. For a visual guide, you can follow the video tutorial (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7XIH3J6tghw).

additional_services: Insert card in ATM and generate OTP.
Set new PIN using OTP received.

atm_services.description: Everest Bank provides round-the-clock ATM services for cash withdrawal and account inquiries through a comprehensive network of ATMs across Nepal. Everest Bank has a pioneering achievement in ATM service by tying up with Punjab National Bank (PNB), India, enabling the operation of Debit cards of the bank at PNB ATM terminals in India and vice versa through SCT – FSS Switch Sharing Arrangement. EBL debit cardholders can draw cash and inquire account balances from over 9000 PNB ATM machines in India. Similarly, PNB cardholders can draw cash and inquire account balances from EBL ATMs in Nepal. Subsidized transaction charges are levied under this arrangement. The huntine line is 00977-1-4543377 and email is atmcell@ebl.com.np. EBL ATMs accept cards from various brands, including SmartChoice Technologies (SCT), Punjab National Bank (PNB), Visa, MasterCard, Maestro, Diners Club, Discover, UPI (Union Pay International), and JCB (Japan Credit Bureau).

general.What is EBL TOUCH 24?: EBL TOUCH 24 is a convenient and safe transaction banking application offered online. You can manage and access your bank accounts quickly and securely.
general.What banking facilities can I do through:
EBL TOUCH 24 application helps you to access and manage all your accounts to perform the following services:

- Online Self Registration
- Online password reset facility
- Login with mobile number
- Biometric login enabled
- Bill Payments:
  - Utility bills like electricity KHANEPANI internet TV
  - Other payments like insurance policy payments School & college fees shares etc.
  - Purchase online tickets of airlines bus movies tour packages etc.
  - Direct Top-up to NTC NCELL ADSL SMARTCELL DISHOME SIMTV etc.
  - Pay your any credit card bills (any bank)
  - Load funds to ESEWA
  - Schedule a payment
  - Save payments for easy payments.
  - Get all your payments invoice.
- Accounts and Statement:
  - View all accounts details in one screen.
  - View latest transaction.
  - View full transaction history between applicable dates.
  - Download statement in pdf format.
- Checks:
  - View your Check book status
  - Online Check stop facility in case or lost or theft.
- Fund Transfer:
  - Transfer funds between your-self linked EBL accounts.
  - Transfer funds to third party accounts in Everest Bank
  - Transfer funds to other bank account.
  - Fone-Pay direct transfer to mobile number
  - Schedule a payment
  - Save payments for easy payments.
  - Get all your payments invoice.
  - Add a counter party and be safe while transacting.
- Add Counter party:
  - Add third party account name and account number.
- Logs:
  - Alert log
  - Activity log
- More option:
  - Locate ATMs and branches with its route navigation.
  - Get instant notifications from debit or credit on account activities.
  - Get latest foreign exchange rates issued by the bank and stock market value of the bank.
  - Bank’s official Colander
  - Easy EMI –calculator
general.How can I enroll in EBL TOUCH 24?:
To enroll in Mobile banking you can choose any of two choices:
1) Self registration:
After providing your personal details such as Account number Card Number and mobile number you will receive one OTP and after providing you can login to mobile banking.

2) Need to visit the nearby branch and fill the registration form.
Once the bank personal verifies your mobile number with the account number you provide you will be sent with the registration confirmation message with your login password.

Note: During registration your account will be deduced by standard charge. Make sure you have enough balance in your account to activate your service required.
general.What is my Login password?: Login password is the secret code used for authentication during the login process if you are using smart phone mobile with activated internet connection in it.
general.What is my Transaction Password?: Transaction password is the secret code used for transaction (withdrawing your account) during the fund transfer bill payments or to get the recharge card.
general.How do I get the application installed i:
The EBL TOUCH 24 application is available in android and iOS platform. To download the application please visit:
- Android: Google play store and search for EBL TOUCH 24
- iPhone: Apple app store and search for EBL TOUCH 24
general.What is Self Registration?: Self registration is a process where user can enroll for the services by sending few personal information and after completion of process you can login to mobile banking and start using it.
general.How to do self Registration?: Self registration is a convenient way to register for EBL TOUCH 24 application from online. You need to provide your personal details such as Account number Card Number and mobile number which will be verified in the system and upon verification you will receive one OTP. After completion of process you can login to mobile banking and start using it.
general.What do I do after I receive the Message:
Once you install the EBL TOUCH 24 application in your mobile phone for android phone please log in EBL TOUCH 24 with the login credentials you received through SMS message. The username will be your registered mobile number in the bank. After successful registration you will be asked to change your login password and transaction password successively. Login password will be alphanumeric and one special character. e.g.: Abc@123. Transaction password will be of four numeric digits.

Once you set your new login and transaction password you need to log in again with the new password to use the service.

In addition please keep all the login password transaction password safe and confidential. Do not share it to anyone.
general.Will I be able to access all of my accou: Yes you can access all of your accounts using EBL TOUCH 24.
general.What happens if I forget my password?:
If you forget your password it must be reset. You can reset your password by:
- Clicking on have trouble signing in option (self-reset) or
- Visiting nearest branch and submit request to reset the password.

Bank may charge minimum amount for this service as per bank’s rules and regulations.
general.What is have trouble signing in option?:
This option helps you to reset your password. You need to follow these simple steps:
- Click on have trouble signing in option
- Provide your personal information after verification you will ask for secret picture.
- Select three secret picture which you have selected previously.
- Input OTP sent to your mobile and you can now reset the password.
general.Can I use any kind of password?: For login password you must use the password having alphabetical (At least one character in Capital format e.g. ABC…) numerical (123…) and special characters (@ $ # *…) to use Mobile Banking.
general.I used wrong password to login but after: You need to visit your nearest branch and fill & submit the unblock request form to unblock the password.
general.What time does it take to unblock my pas: It usually takes 24 hours or will be done by end of the day.
general.What happens to my Mobile Banking if I c: If you change your mobile phone you should visit your nearest branch and first you need to update your KYC then your app will be reset to new mobile number.
general.What are the charges while transferring: If you are transferring money inside Everest Bank’s Account it will not bear any charges. However Interbank Fund transfer may attract charges as per the Bank’s rules and regulations.
general.How much money/fund can I transfer per d: Per transaction maximum amount NPR 100000 and Total Maximum transaction NPR 1000000/- Per month.
general.Who do I contact if I face problem while: You can send screenshot message at data@ebl.com.np or contact any branch of Everest Bank. Or you can directly contact our customer care.
general.I am a POA holder of an account; can I a: No! POA holders are not allowed to apply for EBL TOUCH 24.
general.Can a single mobile number be used for r: No! Two different registrations of two separate customers cannot be done through single mobile number. However you can view all of your accounts linked with same CUSTOMER_ID.
general.How secure is EBL TOUCH 24 application?:
EBL TOUCH 24 uses Extended Two-Factor Authentication (ETFA) to provide optimum security to your banking transactions. The security features include:
- It is registered in your mobile device only.
- All details are system verified without human intervention.
- For genuine user verification we use secret picture option.
- Security PIN is generated by computer and sent to your mobile phone. So no one else knows your security PIN.
- Biometric authentication can be enabled for both login and transaction.
- We give you the option to add and choose Counter Party. This way you can avoid the risk of transferring funds in unknown accounts.

If you lose your mobile phone please call Customer Care @ Toll Free No: 16600171718 immediately so that we will block your Mobile Banking Services.
general.What are the Mobile Banking Fees Charges:
Description:
- Corporate Mobile Banking + SMS Alert: Rs. 500/-
- Individual SMS Alert only: Rs. 200/-
- Mobile Banking + SMS Alert: Rs. 300/-
- Mobile No. Modification/linking new account: Free
- Repin generation: Rs. 75/-
- Renewal Period: 1 Year

Payment Limits:
- Per transaction maximum limit amount: NPR 100000/-
- Per day transaction limit amount: NPR 300000/-
- Per month transaction limit amount: NPR 2000000/-

Wallet Transfer Limits:
- Per transaction maximum limit amount: NPR 25000/-
- Per day transaction limit amount: NPR 50000/-
- Per month transaction limit amount: NPR 1000000/-

Note:
- Mobile Banking Service will be renewed automatically every year.
- Fee and Charges will be deducted automatically from the account.

general.What documents are required from individ: To dematerialize shares as an individual you need to submit a completely filled Application form (Annexure 12 of CDS Byelaws 2068) with witnesses' signatures a copy of citizenship certificate NRN Certificate (for Non-Residential Nepalese) guardianship certificate for minors and passport size photos.
general.What documents are required from institu: Institutions need to submit an Application form (Annexure 13 of CDS Byelaws 2068) Entity Registration Certificate PAN certificate Board Minute approving the BO account Power of Attorney for account operation and passport size photo of the account operator.
general.How can ownership be transferred for sec: For securities acquired from a court order submit an attested copy of the decision citizenship certificate of the receiver and execution slips of the court along with a TRF application.
general.How can ownership of securities be trans: To transfer securities within three generations of the same family submit the application with documents proving family relationship citizenship certificates of transferor and transferee original share certificates and attested relationship certificate.
general.How can a BO transfer ownership of secur: To transfer ownership of securities due to separation submit a TRF along with attested citizenship certificates of receiver and giver and a registered deed from the Land Revenue Office.
general.How can heirs/nominee claim securities i: Heirs/nominee should submit a Transmission Request Form (TRF) with attested copies of death registration certificate citizenship certificates of the deceased and heir relationship certificate and consent letters from other heirs.
general.Who receives corporate benefits on pledg: The pledgor retains ownership of pledged securities and receives corporate benefits while they remain pledged in the pledgor’s account.
general.How is a pledge invoked?: In case of default by the pledgor the pledgee can invoke the pledged securities with the help of a DP after giving formal notice to the pledgor.
general.How are securities unpledged in the CDSC: Securities are unpledged in the CDSC system through a specified procedure.
general.Can pledged securities be dematerialized: Pledged securities can be dematerialized with prior permission from the pledgee bank.
general.Can demat securities be pledged?: Demat securities can be pledged against loans provided by banks and financial institutions.
general.When are allotted securities credited to: Allotted securities are credited to the demat account on the effective date prescribed by the issuer or RTA.
general.Is there any priority in allotment of de: There is no priority in allotment of securities whether applied in dematerialized or physical form.
general.Will CDSC open a demat account for an in: No CDSC will not open a demat account for such requests; rights/bonus shares will be issued in physical form.
general.Who provides the application form for ri: The issuer or RTA provides the application form for rights issue to BOs.
general.Can rights and bonus shares be issued di: Yes rights and bonus shares can be directly credited to the demat account of BOs.
general.How can BOs verify the credit of IPO sec: BOs can verify the credit of IPO securities through allotment advice from the company statement of account from DP or CDSC’s 'Electronic Access to Securities Information (easi)' if subscribed.
general.What happens if there is an error in the: An error in the demat account number may lead to rejection of the IPO application; correction requests can be made to the RTA.
general.Is there a specific way BOs need to ment: Yes IPO forms have dedicated fields for entering demat account details for direct credit of allotted shares.
general.What are the procedures for getting secu: The procedures for getting securities allotted through IPO in electronic form involve...
general.What are the probable reasons for the re: The probable reasons for rejection of DRF include...
general.What is an Instruction Slip?: An instruction slip is the instruction given by BO to debit the securities from their demat account...
general.What is Client Level Pay-In? What are th: Client Level Pay-In is the facility to deliver securities directly to the Clearing House from the demat account...
general.How is the settlement number indicated o: The settlement number on the DIS has 7 digits where the first 4 digits represent the settlement year...
general.What are On-Market Transaction and Off-M: On-Market transactions involve buying/selling of securities traded in NEPSE floor and settled through the Clearing House...
general.What is the procedure for transfer of ho: The procedure for transfer of demat holdings involves...
general.What is the rematerialization process?: Rematerialization process allows electronic holdings to be converted back into physical certificate form...
general.Do BOs have to pay any charges for demat: BOs do not have to pay charges for dematerialization of securities but they must pay charges for rematerialization as per Bye-Laws...
general.Can electronic holdings be converted bac: Yes electronic holdings can be converted back into physical certificates through the rematerialization process...
general.How long will it take to complete the de: The dematerialization process takes 13 working days after submission of application form and physical certificates...
general.Do dematerialized securities have distin: Dematerialized securities do not have distinct numbers; all securities are fungible in demat form...
general.Can odd lots of shares be dematerialized: Yes odd lots of shares can be dematerialized in the demat system...
general.What should one do if one wants to demat: In such cases the security must first be admitted with CDSC before dematerialization can occur...
general.Can one have part of one’s holdings in d: Yes a BO can choose to hold securities in both demat and physical form...
general.Can any physical certificates be demater: Only securities held in an individual’s ownership can be converted into electronic form...
general.Is it compulsory to mention the ISIN whi: Yes the ISIN should be correctly mentioned in the DRF; if unknown it can be obtained from the DP or CDSC website...
general.Why do BOs have to open a demat account: Opening a demat account allows BOs to enjoy benefits such as instant transfer of ownership immediate settlement cycle and easy management of portfolio...
general.Is dematerialization mandatory?: According to Securities’ Central Depository Services Regulation dematerialization is mandatory for BOs to transact in the capital market...
general.What should BOs do if the statements of: BOs should immediately inform their DP about the lost statement and submit an application for a copy...
general.What should BOs do if there are any disc: BOs should contact their DP immediately; if unresolved they should approach CDSC directly...
general.How do BOs get information that the DP h: BOs receive transaction updates through periodic statements provided by their DP or through CDSC’s Electronic Access to Securities Information (easi)...
general.Do BOs have to maintain any minimum bala: No a demat account can be maintained even with zero balance...
general.Can there be a possibility of mix-up of: No each security in demat form has a distinct ISIN number and is accounted separately...
general.Can all securities be dematerialized thr: Yes any number of securities admitted with CDSC can be dematerialized and held in a single demat account...
general.Do all DPs have access to account detail: No each DP only has access to account details of BOs for whom they provide depository services...
general.What are the benefits of opening a demat: Opening a demat account eliminates risks associated with physical certificates allows for immediate transfer and settlement of securities aids in easy portfolio management and more...
general.Can an investor already having a demat a: Yes an investor can open multiple demat accounts with CDSC...
general.Can a demat account be directly opened w: No a demat account can only be opened through a DP of CDSC...
general.What are the benefits for issuers in the: CDSC offers benefits to issuers such as time and cost savings reduction in administrative workload improved transparency and more efficient corporate actions handling...
general.What precaution does CDSC apply for the: The data in CDSC system is safeguarded from unauthorized access misuse and loss through precautions such as local backup remote backup and a disaster recovery site. Additionally DPs maintain daily transaction backups.
general.What are the services provided by a DP t: DPs provide services including opening demat accounts dematerialization and rematerialization of securities maintaining electronic records of securities settling trades facilitating off-market trades crediting IPO securities and handling corporate benefits and pledging of dematerialized securities.
general.Can different securities issued by the s: No different securities issued by the same issuer will have different ISIN codes.
general.What is an ISIN (International Securitie: An ISIN is a unique 12-digit alphanumeric code assigned to securities when they are admitted into the depository system. The first two digits indicate the country of registration.
general.What is BOID (Beneficial Owner Identific: BOID is a unique 16-digit identification number assigned to BOs who open demat accounts through a registered DP. It must be used in all future transactions and ensures securities are transferred correctly.
general.Who is a Depository Participant (DP)?: A Depository Participant is an agent of the depository authorized to offer depository services to investors.
general.Who is a Beneficiary Owner (BO)?: A Beneficiary Owner is a person who opens a demat account with CDSC through a DP to hold securities in electronic form.
general.What is the purpose of opening a demat a: The purpose includes converting physical securities to electronic form depositing and transferring NEPSE-listed securities crediting IPO and corporate action securities receiving account statements pledging securities and rematerializing securities.
general.What is dematerialization?: Dematerialization is the process of converting physical securities into electronic form.
general.What are the parties involved with CDSC?: Parties involved are Beneficial Owners (BOs) Depository Participants (DPs) Issuers Registrars and Transfer Agents (RTAs) and Stock Brokers.
general.What are the services provided by CDSC?: CDSC provides services including deposit withdrawal and transfer of securities electronic credit of IPO securities safeguarding investor securities quick distribution of securities from IPOs and corporate actions pledge/un-pledge of securities and providing updated statements.
general.What is the objective of CDSC?: The objective is to dematerialize securities and maintain accurate records on behalf of buyers ensuring secure transactions.
general.What kind of company is CDS and Clearing: CDSC is the sole depository in Nepal established to dematerialize securities under Company Act 2063 wholly owned by Nepal Stock Exchange Ltd. (NEPSE).
general.What is a depository?: A depository holds and facilitates transactions of securities in electronic form ensuring ownership guarantee and maintaining investor records.
general.How many days does it take to credit the: Transaction executed + 1 working day in case of directly sent from our correspondent banks.
general.What are the inward SWIFT charges of EBL:
For NPR account - NPR 150
For FCY account - FCY 1.5 (e.g. 1.5 GBP for GBP account)
For Third banks - NPR 500
general.Which are the correspondent banks for di:
For USD - Standard Chartered Bank New York; Mashreq Bank New York; Woori Bank New York; Korea Exchange Bank Seoul; Bank of China Beijing China; Habib American Bank New York
For EUR - Standard Chartered Bank Frankfurt Germany
For GBP - Standard Chartered Bank London United Kingdom
For AUD - Westpac Banking Corporation Sydney Australia
For JPY - Standard Chartered Bank Tokyo Japan
For INR - Punjab National Bank New Delhi; Standard Chartered Bank Kolkata. Details are on the website www.everestbankltd.com.
general.How can we send money via SWIFT to an ac: Please contact your bank with our bank’s SWIFT code account number of the receiver and our correspondent bank’s name.
general.What is SWIFT?: SWIFT stands for Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication. It provides a network that enables financial institutions worldwide to send and receive information about financial transactions in a secure standardized and reliable environment.
general.What is the limit of receiving cash for: Remittance amounting Rs. 2.00 lac and above shall be through Bank account only.
general.What is the threshold limit for amounts:
For amounts beyond the threshold limit of Rs. 10 Lacs or equivalent foreign currency documents required to be submitted by the Beneficiary include:

i. Indemnity Form to be filled by the beneficiary at the branch where Beneficiary’s account is maintained.
ii. Source of fund
iii. Purpose of fund
general.What are the other remittances which can: Xpress Money Western Union Money Gram CG remit
general.Can we receive money directly from Unite: Yes remittance can be received from XOOM PayPal using their web-based portal. There is direct account credit facility as well as cash pick up facility.
general.How do we receive amount remitted via Ev: Third bank account credit facility is available via IPS.
general.Can customers receive remittance to thei: Yes customers can receive remittance to accounts other than Everest Bank.
general.How can I check the nearest paying agent: The details are available on Bank’s website www.everestbankltd.com on the Remittance portal under 'Remittance Payout Location'.
general.Which are the exchange houses outside Ne: The details are available on Bank’s website www.everestbankltd.com on the Remittance portal under 'Inward Remittance'.
general.What is the reference number pattern of: Reference numbers range from 9 to 14 digits in numeric or alphanumeric order. Detailed information is available on Bank’s website www.everestbankltd.com on the Remittance portal.
general.From which country do we receive remitta: The details are available on Bank’s website www.everestbankltd.com on the Remittance portal under 'Inward Remittance'.
general.How do we receive amount remitted from I: Third bank account credit facility is available via IPS.
general.How many days does it take to receive am: Same day received from IN-REMIT (via Indo Nepal Remittance) through any branches of Punjab National Bank.
general.Do we have tie-ups with other banks for: Yes we have tie-ups with HDFC and SCB India and we receive transactions from these banks too.
general.What are the modes of remittance which c: It can be account transfer or cash payment.
general.What are the charges for Indo-Remit?: INR 3 per thousand or INR 50 whichever is higher.
general.What is the max/min limit of amount whic: Cash deposit below INR 50000/-; amounts over and above INR shall be transferred through cheque only or by the account holder in India.
general.How do I register for a new bill payee s:
You can register for a new biller by following these steps:

Steps-1: To set up E-Sewa Payee (this is for one time) go to main menu -> transactions -> transaction support service -> manage biller -> register biller -> Register -> fill the required fields and click on continue.

Steps-2: Verify the entered details (you can edit if there is any mistake) and enter your User ID Transaction Password.
general.What are the charges applied for EBL Deb:
Card Issuance Charge: NPR 250.00
Renewal Charges: NPR 250.00
ATM Transaction Fee (Annual): NPR 250.00
SMS Alert Charge (Annual): NPR 150.00
general.What are the debit card transaction fees:
Cash Withdrawal Fee (Per Txn.):

- SCT Card: NIL
- Visa Card: NIL
- Everest Bank ATM: NIL
- HBL ATM: NPR 25
- Other SCT Network ATM Nepal: NPR 25
- Other Network ATM / Nepal: NA
- Visa Network ATM / India (PNB ATMs in case of SCT Card): INR 200 (NPR 250)

Balance Inquiry Fee (Per Txn.):

- Everest Bank ATM: 1st inquiry per day free NPR 2/- onward
- HBL ATM: NPR 3
- Other SCT Network ATM Nepal: NPR 3
- Other Network ATM / Nepal: NA
- Visa Network ATM / India (PNB ATMs in case of SCT Card): INR 24 (NPR 25)
general.Are there any fees for using my debit ca: No there are no fees for using your debit card for retail outlet transactions.
general.How to use a debit card for retail trans:
When you are ready to check out from a retail store:

Step 1: The merchant dips or swipes your card at a Point of Sale (POS) terminal.
Step 2: The merchant enters the transaction amount on the POS terminal and verifies the transaction amount.
Step 3: The POS machine will prompt for the debit card PIN to be entered by you. Please do not disclose your debit card PIN to the merchant.
Step 4: Once you enter the correct PIN and sign the charge slip the transaction is confirmed and completed and the transaction amount will get deducted from your bank account.
Step 5: Ensure that the debit card is returned to you.

Note: All POS machines may not prompt you to insert PIN. Only those machines that are compliant with EMV technology ask for the PIN.
general.Will I get any intimation for my debit c: Yes NRB has made subscription of SMS alert mandatory for all debit card owners. You will receive SMS alerts for all card transactions to your mobile number registered with the Bank. If you have not registered your mobile number for SMS alert please visit your nearest branch and register it mandatorily.
general.Can I get a supplementary card?: No as per NRB guidelines a supplementary/additional card cannot be provided.
general.If I request for a new PIN when will it: The new PIN will be delivered to the branch you have applied for within 7 working days from the date of request.
general.If I have forgotten my PIN or enter inco: You can attempt PIN three times. If all attempts are incorrect your card/PIN would be temporarily blocked. If you remember your PIN you can contact the bank branch to refresh/activate your PIN. If you have forgotten your PIN please contact your bank branch to get a new PIN.
general.Do I require to change PIN once I receiv: Yes it is better to change the PIN once you receive it from the bank. For SCT card you must change the PIN at the time of the first attempt. You can change your debit card PIN by selecting the PIN Change option at EBL ATMs.
general.What is a CVV number?: CVV refers to Card Verification Value which is a three-digit code printed on the reverse of the card. This value is required as a form of authentication for online transactions.
general.What information is written on my EBL de:
On the front side of your Debit Card:

(a) 16 digit card number
(b) Debit card validity date
(c) Cardholder’s name
general.I have received EBL debit card is it rea: No your Debit Card is in inactive state when you receive it. You can start using your debit card after 5:00 PM of the day you have received it as the cards are activated after 5:00 PM.
general.Can I get my debit card without visiting: No you have to personally visit the branch to get your Debit Card.
general.How early could I get EBL debit card aft:
EBL offers two types of Debit Cards:

(a) Embossed card (Personalized card): Within a week from your own branch.
(b) Instant card (Non-personalized card): Instantly at the time of request.
general.How can I apply for EBL debit card?: You need to have an account with us to apply for an EBL Debit Card. If you don’t have an account you can apply for the card at the time of opening your account with us. Please visit one of our branches that is convenient for you.
general.Where can I use EBL debit card?: EBL Visa brand Debit Card can be used in all Visa & SCT affiliated ATM and POS outlets in Nepal and India. EBL SCT-UPI co-branded Debit Card can be used in all SCT affiliated ATM and POS outlets in Nepal and Punjab National Bank (PNB) ATMs in India.
general.What are the types of debit card offered:
EBL offers two brands of Debit Cards:

(a) Visa brand Debit Card
(b) SCT – UPI co-branded Debit Card
general.What is debit card?: A Debit Card is a payment card linked to your deposit account. You can use this card to withdraw cash from your accounts as well as make purchases at merchant locations for payment of goods and services.
general.What is the difference between an ATM ca: An ATM card is primarily used for cash withdrawal at ATMs. A Debit Card can be used at ATMs for cash withdrawal as well as at Point of Sale (POS) merchant outlets and online payment portals for making purchases online directly debiting from your bank account.
general.How do I receive money in accounts of ba: EBL arranges for third-party bank account credit facility via Interbank Payment System. Contact your branch for more details.
general.What should I do if I get the error mess: Your transaction password is valid for 90 days. You can change it by logging into Internet Banking Services and using the change password option.
general.Why am I getting the error message 'Tran: This message appears due to exceptions in the account you are debiting. Please visit your branch to rectify the issue.
general.How can I resolve 'You Have Exceeded The: Your login password gets blocked after 5 unsuccessful attempts. Contact your branch to reactivate your login.
general.What should I do if I receive 'Invalid L: If your login password is disabled contact your nearest branch to reactivate your user ID.
general.Will I receive an alert when I change my: No SMS alerts are not sent for changing the transaction password.
general.Do I receive alerts on my mobile for tra: Yes if you have registered for SMS alert facility you will receive alerts for all transactions.
general.How can I transfer funds through Interne: You can transfer funds via Self-Transfer (within your own accounts) or Third Party Transfer (within Everest Bank Limited).
general.Can I transfer funds between my own acco: Yes you can transfer funds within your accounts or to other accounts within Everest Bank Limited.
general.Can I save my account statement on my PC: Yes you can save the downloaded account information through Internet Banking on your PC.
general.Can I access my accounts when I am out o: Yes you can access your accounts from anywhere provided you have internet access.
general.How can I add more accounts in Internet: You can add accounts maintained by you at any of our branches to your existing Internet Banking Services. Submit your request at the branch.
general.How can I contact the helpdesk of Intern: You can contact the Customer Call Centre at 977-01-5970118 or email customercare@ebl.com.np or visit your nearby branch.
general.How can I recognize spam/fake/fraudulent: Fraudulent emails ask for personal details and may have links to fake websites. Do not respond to such emails.
general.What is my role in enhancing the securit: Keep your PC updated with anti-virus software use strong passwords logout after use and follow security tips from the bank.
general.How can I recognize that the webpage is: Look for 'https://' in the URL and a lock icon in the browser window. Click on the lock icon to view site details.
general.Is it safe to login from a cyber cafe?: Accessing Internet Banking from a cyber cafe is not recommended due to security risks. If necessary use precautions like using the dynamic keyboard.
general.How do I change my address or update my: Update your KYC details at the nearest branch for changes in address and email ID.
general.Why am I unable to open the Internet Ban: Clear the cache/history from your browser and use an updated browser to resolve this issue.
general.How can I reset my password?: You can reset your password by using the 'Forget Password' option on the IBS site. Alternatively request a new password at the branch.
general.Does the bank ask for the IBS password?: No the bank will never ask for your passwords. Do not respond to any communication asking for your personal information.
general.What are the good practices for creating: Choose a password that is not a dictionary word change it frequently and do not share it with anyone.
general.Why are two separate passwords provided: The login password grants access while the transaction password confirms transactions enhancing security.
general.Can I change the user ID and password?: You can change your user ID and passwords anytime through the IBS portal for enhanced security.
general.Is the User ID and password case sensiti: User ID is not case sensitive but passwords are case sensitive.
general.How many days does it take to get Intern: After submission of IBS form in EBL you may expect the password to be sent to your email within 3 working days.
general.I forgot my User ID of IBS what should I: You may contact the nearest branch or Customer Care Centre at 00977-1-4418878.
general.What is my User ID for Internet Banking: You will receive the IBS UserID immediately upon submission of forms with complete details.
general.I am not in Nepal how do I apply for Int: Download the request form from the Internet Banking website fill it and submit the scanned copy (via email) with the signature of the account holder to the branch where you maintain your account.
general.Can Non Resident Nepali (NRN) use Intern: Yes NRN customers can use Internet Banking services after fulfilling necessary documentation.
general.How do I get User ID and password for In: Upon application for e-banking the password and ID will be sent to your registered email.
general.I do not have an account with Everest Ba: Internet Banking services are available only to EBL customers. Visit any branch to open an account with EBL and apply for Internet Banking.
general.What facilities/services are available t: Internet Banking offers access to accounts (statements quick view details) fund transfers (within bank) cheque status online stop payment of cheques requests (cheque book issuance statements FDs) mails (customer-EBL only) customization (password changes etc.) and payments towards services availed over the Internet.
general.How do I register for Internet Banking s: Register by submitting the form available at branches or downloadable from the website.
general.How much does EBL IBS charge?: EBL IBS banking access is free of charge.
general.What is the URL for Internet Banking?: Visit https://www.netebl.com to be redirected to the Internet Banking Homepage.
general.Who are eligible for Internet Banking se: All account holders of the bank with KYC compliant accounts are eligible for Internet Banking services.
general.What do I need to use the services?: You need at least one account with EBL an electronic device with internet connection compatible browsers (e.g. Google Chrome Firefox) and User ID/password obtained through Internet Banking registration.
general.What is special about Internet Banking s: You can operate your account anywhere and anytime (24*7/365) for convenience.
general.What is Internet Banking Service (IBS)?: Internet Banking Service provides convenient access to your bank account via the internet allowing tasks like viewing statements/balances fund transfers within the bank and wallet uploads.
general.How can we transfer funds to other bank: Use the Fund Transfer menu in Mobile Banking services.
general.How to subscribe to SMS Banking facility: Visit the bank with valid documents and fill out an SMS banking form. Activation takes up to 30 minutes.
general.How to deactivate Mobile Banking service: Submit a written application to your branch for deactivation.
general.What is Self Link Transfer and Third Par: Self Link Transfer allows transfers between your own EBL accounts while Third Party Transfer allows transfers to other persons' EBL accounts.
general.How can I get my User ID?: Visit the branch to retrieve your User ID; it is not sent via SMS or email.
general.Can I stop the transaction initiated thr: Transactions through Mobile Banking Services happen instantaneously and once initiated cannot be stopped reversed or recalled.
general.How many transactions can I do in a day?: You can perform up to ten transactions per day with a per transaction limit of Rs. 10000 and a daily limit of Rs. 50000.
general.I have deleted the application by mistak: Reinstall the application from Play Store (Android) or App Store (iPhone).
general.What happens if I forget to log out or l: EBL Mobile Banking automatically logs out after 3 minutes of inactivity for security.
general.Can I access both Internet Banking and M: Yes you can access both services simultaneously as they are separate channels.
general.What if I get an SMS or a call while per: Answer the call/check the message and continue the banking operation.
general.Are there any additional security precau: Do not reveal passwords over phone email etc. Change passwords frequently and do not share sensitive information via email.
general.Will I be able to use the services while: Yes you can use mobile banking on national and international roaming but you will only receive OTPs if using the registered mobile number.
general.What happens if I lose communication sig: Check transaction status through transaction inquiry when you regain signal.
general.I have changed my mobile number. How can: Visit the branch and fill a form to update your mobile number.
general.I get Session Expired error?: This may be due to loss of connectivity. Restart the application and try again.
general.I get Service Not Available error?: Check your GPRS/data settings or wifi connectivity. Ensure appropriate connectivity plan.
general.I get Maximum Number of Attempts Exceede: Ensure correct password entry. Contact your branch if the issue persists.
general.I get an Invalid Security Pin error?: Verify correct Customer ID/password input. Check and retry.
general.I am not able to connect to Mobile Banki: Contact your branch or Customer Care Center at 4418878 or email customercare@ebl.com.np. For service provider issues contact your internet service provider.
general.How can I download the application on my: Android users can download "EBL Touch-24" from Google Play store and iPhone users from App Store.
general.What are the variants offered in Mobile: EBL Mobile Banking is offered in application-based and SMS-based variants.
general.How can I register for EBL Mobile/SMS Ba: Fill the form at any EBL branch or download from the bank's website.
general.Do I need to register with a particular: EBL Mobile/SMS Banking services are accessible through NTC and NCELL networks. Mobile Banking operates on any network (Wi-Fi hotspot etc.).
general.Are there any prerequisites for availing: You need an account with Everest Bank a valid mobile connection and a handset supporting the services.
general.Can I benefit from EBL Mobile/SMS Bankin: Yes EBL Mobile/SMS Banking services benefit all existing customers of the bank.
general.What services are offered through EBL Mo: Services include balance inquiry transaction inquiry mini bank statement fund transfer utility bill payment password change requests E-Sewa transfer NTC/NCELL top-up and general inquiries.
general.What are the benefits of EBL Mobile/SMS: The services offer a simple and convenient way to bank anytime and anywhere via the bank's mobile application.
general.What is the difference between Mobile Ba: Mobile Banking involves any banking activity through a mobile application while SMS Banking is a specific service provided via SMS.
general.What is Mobile/SMS Banking?: Mobile banking (M-Banking SMS Banking etc.) refers to banking services accessible through mobile phones via the EBL Touch-24 app.
general.I found a transaction on my account usin: Report any fraudulent or disputed debit card transactions to our customer care hotline (01-4418878) or any EBL branch.
general.My current debit card is damaged or lost: Visit the nearest branch to request a replacement debit card.
general.My debit card is expiring soon. Should I: Yes apply for a new debit card before the expiry date at your branch.
general.What should I do if I have lost my debit: Immediately block your Debit Card by calling our Hotline Numbers +977-1-2044142 or +977-014443377 ext. 2011 2012 & 2013.
general.Will I be asked for my ATM PIN at every: If POS terminals require PIN authentication you must enter your debit card PIN. Otherwise no PIN is required.
general.What is the validity of EBL cards?: EBL cards are valid for 4 years with the expiry date printed on the card.
general.What should I do if my debit card is not: Contact us at our Hotline Numbers +977 012044142 or visit your nearest branch for assistance.
general.Can I use my debit card to pay online?: EBL is in the process of enabling online payment systems.

ENTITY & OWNERSHIP.Primary financial regulator/supervisory: NEPAL RASTRA BANK (Central Bank of Nepal)
ENTITY & OWNERSHIP.Business areas applicable: Retail Banking Commercial Banking Transactional Banking Financial Markets Trading Remittance and other activities permitted by BAFIA 2073

PRODUCTS & SERVICES.Other services: Prepaid Card limited banking services as per regulatory guidelines

AML CTF & SANCTIONS PROGRAMME.Programme components: Appointed Officer Adverse Information Screening Beneficial Ownership Cash Reporting CDD EDD Independent Testing Periodic Review Policies and Procedures PEP Screening Risk Assessment Sanctions Suspicious Activity Reporting Training and Education Transaction Monitoring

ANTI-BRIBERY & CORRUPTION.Global ABC policy: Prohibits giving and receiving of bribes

ABC PROGRAMME.If appropriate, provide any additional i: Bank is not having separate ABC policy. However, it is covered by Bank's KYC/AML/CFT policy, Staff Service Byelaws, Financial Byelaws and regulatory guidelines which are subject to review on regular basis.

AML, CTF & SANCTIONS PROGRAMME.If appropriate, provide any additional i: Comprehensive AML/CFT policy is in place. Risk based approach is adopted for AML/CFT purpose. Bank has appointed Chief Compliance Officer to oversee the implementation and adherence to the policy.

himalayan_bank_limited(hbl).bank_vision: To become a Leading Bank of the country by providing premium products and services to customers, ensuring attractive returns to stakeholders.
himalayan_bank_limited(hbl).bank_mission: To be the preferred provider of quality financial services in Nepal, focusing on customer satisfaction and maintaining high service standards.
himalayan_bank_limited(hbl).bank_objectives: To become the Bank of first choice in Nepal.

benefits.deposit_guarantee: Up to Rs. 500,000/- in line with regulatory requirement of Nepal Rastra Bank

jeevan_surakshya_bachat_khata.description: Deposit scheme with Health/Accidental and Death insurance coverage.
free_facilities: Free SCT/VISA Debit Card for 1st year
Free SMS Alert Service for 1st year
In the event of unfortunate death of the life assured, Rs. 50,000/- will be paid to the beneficiary/nominee.
In the event of death due to an accidental cause, an additional Rs. 100,000/- plus Rs. 50,000/- term life coverage amount will be payable. The policy terminates upon payment of death benefit.
In the event of dismemberment or total permanent disability due to an accidental cause, up to Rs. 100,000/- will be paid depending on the severity of dismemberment/disability.

In the event of diagnosis of critical illnesses such as Major Cancer, Strokes, First Heart Attack, Serious Coronary Artery Disease, Heart Valve Surgery, Primary Pulmonary Hypertension, Rs. 100,000/- will be provided for treatment.

special_payroll_account.description: Special deposit scheme designed for corporate houses/institutions and salaried individuals. It allows hassle-free crediting of salary.

features.interest_calculation: Interest rate calculated on daily balance

shareholder_savings.description: Shareholder's Savings scheme is a privileged service to our valued shareholders so that dividend can be easily credited to their accounts. It wipes off the hassle of encashing dividend cheques.
